IV.administration: Reconstitute 2 gms in 20 ml water for injection and give as a bolus over 5 minutes or dilute with saline or 5% glucose to 50-200 ml and infuse over 15-30 minutes.
IV.dose: 2 gm tds. (Some patients can only tolerate 1 gm tds usually due to nausea).

drug.indication: Treatment of Pseudomonas aeruginosa and Burkholderia respiratory infections. Also active against H.influenza and S.aureus.

entry.value: Excretion of meropenem reduced by probenecid. Avoid concomitant use.
Reduces plasma concentration of valproate may lead to subtherapeutic valproate levels.

drug.name: Meropenem

IV.administration: 250 mg reconstituted with 5 ml of WFI and administered over at least 5 minutes or given as an infusion.
IV.dose: 120 mg/kg/day in 3 divided doses. Max 2 g tds.

drug.sideEffect: Nausea, vomiting, diarrhoea, abdo pain, disturbance in LFTs, thrombocytopenia, leucopenia, eosinophilia, neutropenia, headaches, paraesthesia, hypersensitivity reaction s including rash, pruritus , urticaria, angioedema and anaphylaxis; also reported convulsions, phlebitis,oral and vaginal candidiasis.
